p: To a suspension of benzyl glycinate hydrochloride salt (6.83 g, 33.8 mmol) in dichloromethane (200 mL) at 0 °C, a solution of the above sulfonyl chloride (9.0 g, 30.8 mmol) in dichloromethane (30 mL) was added over a period of 20 minutes. The reaction mixture was stirred at 0 °C for 2 hours, washed with ice water. The organic solution was dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate, filtered and concentrated under vacuum to provide benzyl N-({2-[[(benzyloxy)carbonyl](methyl)amino]ethyl}sulfonyl)-glycinate as yellow viscous liquid.
